name: Pomeranian
description: The Pomeranian is spirited, intelligent, and full of charm — a tiny dog with a bold personality. Known for their fluffy double coat and lively nature, Pomeranians are affectionate companions who love attention and activity.

adaptability.description: Pomeranians handle moderate temperatures well but should be kept cool in summer and warm during cold or windy weather due to their small size.

diet.title: DIET
diet.mainDescription: Pomeranians thrive on a nutrient-dense, high-protein small-breed diet to maintain energy, coat health, and dental hygiene.

tips.title: Small-bite kibble
tips.description: Select small-sized kibble rich in animal protein for easy chewing and improved digestion.

tips.title: Omega-rich diet
tips.description: Include fish oil or flaxseed to maintain the signature fluffy coat and healthy skin.

tips.title: Dental-friendly meals
tips.description: Crunchy kibble and dental chews help reduce tartar buildup common in small breeds.

tips.title: Frequent small meals
tips.description: Feed 3–4 small meals daily to maintain blood sugar and energy levels for their fast metabolism.

training.title: POMERANIAN TRAINING
training.mainDescription: Pomeranians are smart and eager learners. Short, engaging sessions with positive reinforcement help keep them focused and responsive.

tips.title: Early socialization
tips.description: Expose them to different people and environments early to prevent excessive barking or nervousness.

tips.title: Basic obedience training
tips.description: Teach essential commands like sit, stay, and come with treats and praise to encourage good manners.

grooming.title: GROOMING
grooming.subtitle: Pomeranians have a thick double coat that requires regular care to prevent matting and maintain their fluffy appearance.
grooming.mainDescription: Pomeranians need regular brushing and coat maintenance to keep their fur tangle-free and shiny.

tips.title: Frequent brushing
tips.description: Brush 3–4 times a week to prevent tangles and matting, especially behind ears and under the legs.

tips.title: Bathing & trimming
tips.description: Bathe every 4–6 weeks and trim excess fur around paws and face to keep them neat and comfortable.
